main.name: I'm Mohamed Khalil Dhaher.
main.bio: I am an athlete at heart, with an entrepreneurial spirit, and a passion for coding. Born in Tunis Bardo, I had my bacalaureat in mathematics, then I had my diploma: superior technician in mechatronics, then I switched I had a certificate as full-stack-developer at RBK Tunisia because I like to solve mathematical problems and I love to create and tend to keep a few too many projects on the go at a time. Outside of work I am an avid motorcyclist, soccer player and wrestler. I love to travel and lead a fairly nomadic lifestyle. I am autonomous, I like to learn new things, I quickly learn new technologies, frameworks ... and dream of being able to take my work with me while travelling the world.
main.contactmessage: Have a project for me? Think I'd be a good fit for your team? I'd love to hear from you, give me a shout by email or by using the form below if you'd like to get in contact with me.

education.description: I was a good element in mathematics that's why I chose the math section in my bachalaureat, I improved my logic to solve mathematical equations, it was a good start for me
I had knowledge in numerical controls, to operate numerical machines, to find solutions to repair the machines, to design parts in 3D using software

I switched to website development because I have always liked logical equations and looking for new solutions, I have a creative mind we can say that I also have an artistic mind so I found that the development is my delirium, at RBK I learned how to work in a team, manage my stress, work in different situations.

work.title: cashier
work.description: know how to communicate well with customers, count the cash register, be up to date with my supervisor

work.title: manager in a cafeteria
work.description: I managed everything: the waiters, the cash register, the receipts, the salaries ...

work.title: installer and maintainer of biomedical radiology machines (MRI, scanner)
work.description: I had knowledge in nuclear medicine, know how to communicate with the owners of the machines who are the doctors and be in follow-up with them
